net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api

Enum BooleanEnum

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BooleanEnum>
      • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.BooleanEnum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<BooleanEnum>, AttributeReadValue<Boolean>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<Boolean>

    public enum BooleanEnum
extends Enum<BooleanEnum>
implements SimpleDatatype<Boolean>
    A BooleanEnum represents a Boolean as enum type. This may seem pointless in the first place but is usable for annotations that can not have null values. However, in this case it is often desirable to express a default that is neither true nor false e.g. if the default can be determined from other values. In such case you can use BooleanEnum instead and NULL as default.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • values

        public static BooleanEnum[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (BooleanEnum c : BooleanEnum.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

        public static BooleanEnum valueOf(String name)

        Parameters:

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Datatype
        Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Overrides:
        toString in class Enum<BooleanEnum>
        Returns:
        the official String representation to display the value of this Datatype.
